alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 08 at 3:02AM MST until January 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult over Teton Pass, Togwotee Pass, and Salt River Pass, as well as in the backcountry. Blowing and drifting snow may significantly reduce visibility. Cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are expected Tuesday afternoon through early Wednesday morning. See weather.gov/riverton/winter for more details on snow potential.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
